column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/0eaaa83ba521af8453c11ad688bdbb6bd4e33870 for binaries and test log.\n
What I find strange is, that my tests in a Ubuntu VM with Gitian, bitcoin-qt showed used OpenSSL version as 0.9.8, is that true, that we use such an "old" version with the official Linux bins?\n
In any proper OS install, the OS is responsible for the version of OpenSSL used.\n
Im a Linux noob, sorry ... but your statement is false for the Windows binary, as we statically link to OpenSSL there ;).\n
Yes, I don't consider Windows to be a proper OS ;)\n
Fine, same is true for me thinking about Linux ;). End of OT then ^^.\n
